Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Bij Olympia zijn we op zoek naar een Junior Data Scientist die ons Data team komt versterken. In deze rol draag je bij aan het ontwikkelen en implementeren van machine learning-oplossingen die vraagstukken oplossen en waarde creëren voor onze organisatie. Je werkt nauw samen met senior teamleden om data-analyses uit te voeren, machine learning-modellen te ontwikkelen, en innovatieve toepassingen te bouwen, met een speciale focus op Large Language Models (LLM).




Verder ben je verantwoordelijk voor:




Data-analyse. Je voert dataverkenning en analyse uit met behulp van Python en SQL om inzicht te krijgen in datasets.
Experimentatie en iteratie. Je voert experimenten uit om de prestaties van machine learning-modellen te verbeteren, waarbij verschillende algoritmen en technieken worden getest.
Samenwerken. Je werkt actief samen met senior data analisten en met collega’s van de vestigingen om projecten te realiseren.
Documenteren. Je documenteert processen, modellen, en resultaten om kennisdeling en reproduceerbaarheid binnen het team te bevorderen.
Cloudgebruik. Je werkt in cloudomgevingen, zoals Azure ML om modellen te trainen, te implementeren en te schalen.




Waar ga je werken?

Als je bij Olympia komt werken ga je een avontuur aan. Je sluit je aan bij een professionele uitzendorganisatie waar bij twee zaken centraal staan: ondernemerschap en impact. Je gaat werken in een gedreven, gemotiveerd en hecht team. Er is veel ruimte voor eigen inbreng.




Jouw standplaats is het Olympia Service Center (hoofdkantoor) van Olympia in Hoofddorp. Wij werken activity based en passen onze werkplek aan op onze activiteiten. Het spreekt voor zich dat (deels) vanuit huis werken tot de mogelijkheden behoort. In principe werken wij twee dagen per week op kantoor.




In de rol van Junior Data Scientist maak je deel uit van de afdeling Data bestaande uit vier collega’s. Je rapporteert aan Coen Seinen (Manager Data & Insights) en die rapporteert aan Gabriella Serreli (CDO).




Wie ben je?

Om succesvol te zijn in je rol als Junior Data Scientist ben je positief en ondernemend ingesteld en beschik je over strategisch en analytisch inzicht.




Je hebt een WO werk- en denkniveau, in de studierichting Data Science, Informatica, Wiskunde, Statistiek of een gerelateerd vakgebied.
Je hebt 0-2 jaar (stage)ervaring in een data sciene-rol.
Je hebt diepe kennis van machine learning-algoritmen en technieken.
Vaardigheid in het gebruik van Python voor data-analyse en machine learning.
Je hebt sterke analytische en probleemoplossende capaciteiten.




Wat mag je verwachten?

Een avontuur bij een top speler onder de Nederlandse uitzendbureaus! Bij Olympia werken we vanuit gedeelde kernwaarden met als ideaal een samenleving waarin iedereen zich optimaal ontwikkelt door werk dat voldoening geeft. Onze ambitie is een high performance en een digital first organisatie te worden. We kunnen je hierdoor een inhoudelijk uitdagende rol bieden. Werken voor Olympia, dat betekent dit voor jou:




Voel je gewaardeerd in een omgeving waar iedereen welkom is
Maak, samen met ons, werk van je persoonlijke groei en ontwikkeling
Haal energie uit onze unieke ‘wij-maken-het-waar’ cultuur
Haal persoonlijke en maatschappelijke betekenis uit werk




En verder bieden we je uiteraard:




Een dienstverband van 36 of 40 uur per week. Jij bepaalt wat het beste bij je past.
Een passend salaris tussen € 3.350 en € 4.794, afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring.
Bovengemiddeld veel vakantiedagen, 32,5 verlofdagen bij een 40-urige werkweek.
Onkostenvergoeding van €105,- netto per maand bij een 40-urige werkweek.
Een mooie bonus aan het einde van het jaar.
Aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals een gunstige pensioenregeling en korting op verzekeringen.
Volledige reiskostenvergoeding op basis van al het openbaar vervoer of een kilometervergoeding vanaf 10 km (€ 23 ct.).
Een laptop en smartphone om je werk goed te kunnen uitvoeren.
8% vakantietoeslag.
Bij Olympia geven we onze collega’s de mogelijkheid om drie officiële feestdagen per jaar om te ruilen voor een andere culturele of religieuze dag die voor hen belangrijk is.
Het hybride werken met de juiste balans van werken op kantoor en vanuit huis.
Een inspirerende, moderne en bovenal duurzame werkplek. Wij zijn gevestigd in het Pharos-gebouw tegenover station Hoofddorp.
Opleidingsmogelijkheden die passen bij jouw ontwikkeldoelen.
Eens per jaar een “Dag van betekenis”. Een vrije dag die je volledig zelf invult om iets te doen wat veel voor je betekent.




Geïnteresseerd?

Wil je meer weten over Olympia? Of meer over de functie als Junior Data Scientist? Onze Recruitment Business Partner Merve Kaplan is bereikbaar op 06 51 05 70 91 of via m.kaplan@olympia.nl. Ken jij iemand anders waarvoor dit dé droombaan zou kunnen zijn? Stuur deze vacature dan vooral door en geef zo betekenis aan werk.

Title: Data Scientist (Smart Agriculture)
Description:
Lay the groundwork for tomorrow with Kubota!




Since 1890, Kubota has evolved in a unique way worldwide. With a strong will to solve problems in food, water and the environment, we have leveraged our strength as a manufacturer and a solutions provider. Spanning across 120+ countries and employing more than 50,000 people in Asia, Europe and North America, Kubota generates revenue in excess of $20 billion. From agricultural and industrial machinery, and overall water solutions, to any other living environment solution, our question, and our challenge was always the same: what can we do to meet the demands and enhance our lives for tomorrow? Explore this exciting career opportunity and join us on the journey as we seek to be an “Essentials Innovator for Supporting Life”.




My job, Our future




Kubota Technology Innovation Europe department

The KTI-EU organization is a newly established department focusing on digital solutions and systems development from both a fundamental and applied research perspective. It bridges the gap between the market research, collaborations and technology mapping (driven by our Innovation Center Europe) and the commercial development done by our R&D centers, like Kubota Research and Development Europe and Kverneland Group. The KTI department centers itself on the European market but in strong collaboration with the global organization and other regional offices e.g., KTI-SV (Silicon Valley, USA) to align and coordinate global initiatives.




In this context and in order to strengthen our team, we are looking to recruit a Data Scientist. This activity is related to analyzing agricultural data, developing predictive models and providing actionable insights to drive informed decision-making in the field of smart agriculture. Not only just analyzing the data, but also be responsible for planning and executing field experiments, including how to collect the data (when, where, how often, with which sensor, what). Therefore, in addition to agricultural knowledge, sensors knowledge like RGB, multi/hyper-spectral, thermal, etc is also required. The contribution is broad, including agricultural crop monitoring, machine monitoring, autonomous driving, monitoring of quality of agricultural work while working with tractors and agricultural implements. This is a critical role for the success of our technology advancements pushing the boundaries of productivity and sustainability.




Responsibilities:

Define and design experiments from data collection to evaluation and support actual data collection in fields

Collecting, cleaning, and analyzing agricultural data to identify patterns and trends
Building predictive models to optimize crop yield, field operation and farm management
Utilize statistical analysis and machine learning techniques to derive insights from agricultural data.
Reflect the results of experimental planning and sensing data analysis in the sensor system
Research relevant papers, formulate a hypothesis, and explore the best approach
Technical information collection, reporting, and evaluation of the AI integrated agricultural products, related sensors.
Work within joint research projects with external local and international partners.




Requirements:

Master’s or Ph.D. in data science, agricultural engineering, or a related field
Proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning, and data visualization
Experience with agricultural data analysis and understanding of farming practices
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or similar
Fluent in English
Communication skills for requirement definition or alignment of specs with global stakeholders by documentation, design reviews, etc.




Nice to have:

Experience of mobile sensing data analysis
Experience of sensor development and sensors knowledge such as RGB, multi/hyper-spectral, thermal sensors
Italian, Spanish or French language proficiency
Experience of collaboration with team members from various backgrounds.
Experience in agricultural mechanistic modeling as well as statistical modeling.
Experience with GIS (Geographic Information Systems)

Title: Data scientist
Description:
Data scientist

Als Data Scientist (speaking dutch fluently) bij Ordina Sopra steria werk je aan gave uitdagende projecten binnen Kunstmatige Intelligentie (AI) in een divers team van collega-data scientist. Jouw expertise en ambities vormen de basis voor onze High-Performance Teams (HPT's), waarin samenwerking en continue ontwikkeling centraal staan.




Werken als Data Scientist bij Ordina Sopra steria

Je wordt een onmisbare schakel in een team van professionals, waar iedereen bijdraagt vanuit zijn eigen expertise en technologie, en waar continue leren en samenwerken wordt gestimuleerd.
Je past je expertise toe in diverse domeinen, onderzoeken van betalingsstromen bij overheidsinstanties, het detecteren van fraude bij banken, het ontwikkelen van aanbevelingssystemen in de detailhandel, en het optimaliseren van supply chains.
Je ontwikkelt en implementeert oplossingen met Machine Learning en Deep Learning, en evalueert de prestaties van voorspellende modellen.




Waar jij komt te werken

In ons Data-domein creëren we duurzame waarde voor klanten door data en technologie te integreren in dagelijkse operaties en strategische besluitvorming. Ons doel is organisaties te helpen excelleren met data.




Het Data-domein omvat vijf praktijken: Data Governance, Data Management, Data Visualisatie, Data Science en AI, Data Engineering en Data Migraties, en Spatial Intelligence. Elke praktijk biedt gerichte oplossingen en wordt ondersteund door meer dan 170 professionals met diverse expertise. Wij geloven in de kracht van multidisciplinaire teams.




Dit ben jij

Jij bent een enthousiaste en ondernemende professional die initiatief neemt en graag bijdraagt aan een collegiale werkomgeving. Je waardeert kennisdeling en samenwerking, en bent in staat om jouw ideeën en inzichten te delen met collega's. Met een proactieve houding ben je gemotiveerd om samen met anderen innovatieve oplossingen te ontwikkelen. In onze organisatie krijg je de ruimte om je ondernemerschap te tonen en bij te dragen aan een cultuur waarin teamwork en continue ontwikkeling centraal staan.




Verder neem je mee:

Bachelor en of masterdiploma of gelijkwaardige ervaring in Data Science, Machine Learning of Software Engineering.
Minimaal 2 jaar praktijkervaring met machine learning technieken en programmeertalen zoals Python of R.
Ervaring met implementatie van Data Science-oplossingen in productieomgevingen (bijv. Azure, AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, Docker, enz.).
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal.




Waarom Ordina Sopra steria?

Naast uitdagende werkmogelijkheden, een open werkcultuur en leuke collega’s, bieden wij jou ook de vrijheid en flexibiliteit om je professionele doelen te behalen door een ruim aanbod aan trainingen aan te bieden. Daarnaast bieden wij ook de volgende andere punten:

Een vast contract
Basis salaris tussen de €4000 en €6500 o.b.v. 40 uur
Flexibele werkomgeving waar je zelfstandig tijd en plaats kunt bepalen
Mobiliteitsbudget met keuze voor een leaseauto of eigen vervoer
Flex benefit budget en collectieve regelingen
Keuze uit een MacBook Pro (inc Apple accessoires) of Windows laptop
Een betrokken community gericht op teambuilding, gaming en evenementen




Iedereen is welkom om te solliciteren. Wij geloven namelijk in de kracht van diversiteit en waarderen inclusie. De beste ideeën en slimste oplossingen ontstaan immers in diverse teams. Daarom besteden we veel aandacht aan de samenstelling van onze high-performance teams. Zodat jij je thuis voelt en het beste uit jezelf kunt halen.




Ben je klaar om je carrière een boost te geven? Solliciteer dan direct voor de functie van Data Scientist bij Ordina sopra steria!

Show more

Title: Data Scientist, Product Analytics
Description:
As a Data Scientist at Meta, you will shape the future of people-facing and business-facing products we build across our entire family of applications (Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp, Oculus). By applying your technical skills, analytical mindset, and product intuition to one of the richest data sets in the world, you will help define the experiences we build for billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses around the world. You will collaborate on a wide array of product and business problems with a diverse set of cross-functional partners across Product, Engineering, Research, Data Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Finance and others. You will use data and analysis to identify and solve product development’s biggest challenges. You will influence product strategy and investment decisions with data, be focused on impact, and collaborate with other teams. By joining Meta, you will become part of a world-class analytics community dedicated to skill development and career growth in analytics and beyond.Product leadership: You will use data to shape product development, quantify new opportunities, identify upcoming challenges, and ensure the products we build bring value to people, businesses, and Meta. You will help your partner teams prioritize what to build, set goals, and understand their product’s ecosystem.Analytics: You will guide teams using data and insights. You will focus on developing hypotheses and employ a diverse toolkit of rigorous analytical approaches, different methodologies, frameworks, and technical approaches to test them.Communication and influence: You won’t simply present data, but tell data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your partners using clear insights and recommendations. You will build credibility through structure and clarity, and be a trusted strategic partner.

Data Scientist, Product Analytics Responsibilities:


Work with large and complex data sets to solve a wide array of challenging problems using different analytical and statistical approaches.
Apply technical expertise with quantitative analysis, experimentation, data mining, and the presentation of data to develop strategies for our products that serve billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses.
Identify and measure success of product efforts through goal setting, forecasting, and monitoring of key product metrics to understand trends.
Define, understand, and test opportunities and levers to improve the product, and drive roadmaps through your insights and recommendations.
Partner with Product, Engineering, and cross-functional teams to inform, influence, support, and execute product strategy and investment decisions.


Minimum Qualifications:


A minimum of 6 years of work experience in analytics (minimum of 4 years with a Ph.D.).
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, a relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), and/or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R).


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

As a Data Scientist at Meta, you will shape the future of people-facing and business-facing products we build across our entire family of applications (Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp, Oculus). By applying your technical skills, analytical mindset, and product intuition to one of the richest data sets in the world, you will help define the experiences we build for billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses around the world. You will collaborate on a wide array of product and business problems with a diverse set of cross-functional partners across Product, Engineering, Research, Data Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Finance and others. You will use data and analysis to identify and solve product development’s biggest challenges. You will influence product strategy and investment decisions with data, be focused on impact, and collaborate with other teams. By joining Meta, you will become part of a world-class analytics community dedicated to skill development and career growth in analytics and beyond.Product leadership: You will use data to shape product development, quantify new opportunities, identify upcoming challenges, and ensure the products we build bring value to people, businesses, and Meta. You will help your partner teams prioritize what to build, set goals, and understand their product’s ecosystem.Analytics: You will guide teams using data and insights. You will focus on developing hypotheses and employ a diverse toolkit of rigorous analytical approaches, different methodologies, frameworks, and technical approaches to test them.Communication and influence: You won’t simply present data, but tell data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your partners using clear insights and recommendations. You will build credibility through structure and clarity, and be a trusted strategic partner.

Data Scientist, Product Analytics Responsibilities:

  • Work with large and complex data sets to solve a wide array of challenging problems using different analytical and statistical approaches.
  • Apply technical expertise with quantitative analysis, experimentation, data mining, and the presentation of data to develop strategies for our products that serve billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses.
  • Identify and measure success of product efforts through goal setting, forecasting, and monitoring of key product metrics to understand trends.
  • Define, understand, and test opportunities and levers to improve the product, and drive roadmaps through your insights and recommendations.
  • Partner with Product, Engineering, and cross-functional teams to inform, influence, support, and execute product strategy and investment decisions.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • A minimum of 6 years of work experience in analytics (minimum of 4 years with a Ph.D.).
  • Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, a relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), and/or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R).

About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences team is dedicated to empowering healthcare organizations ton achieve their goals and improve patient care. We aim to create an efficient and connected healthcare ecosystem by bringing the healthcare ecosystem together which empowers everyone across the healthcare journey to collaborate, communicate, and innovate together to provide better experiences for their workforces and patients or members alike.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:


Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch


Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:


This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
Experience with text summarization and/or text generation


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you passionate about both data science and (strategic) consulting? Do you like to create insights and turn them into action to create lasting impact? We are searching for an experienced Data Scientist for our Data & AI team to support our clients by combining business sense with data modelling. If this description fits your profile, we are looking for you!

The Data & AI team at IG&H is using the latest data and AI technology to help our clients innovate. To do so, our team of 25 data experts works closely together with our Technology and Sector teams. Through smart collaboration, we have delivered over 40 (Gen)AI projects in the last two years for our clients in Retail, Healthcare and Financial Services. As a Data Scientist, you will play a central role in truly understanding our client’s needs, translating this into value, creating solutions, developing Gen(AI) models and turning them into action. We believe it is key to have business sense as well as broad experience with data related topics (analytics, artificial intelligence, etc.) to create real business value. On top of that, you need to be able to communicate clearly and convincingly. Not only for effective project execution, but also to inspire (internal) stakeholders on the latest trends and developments in the field of Data and AI.

You will typically work in multidisciplinary project teams for one project at a time. Although being able to deliver work independently is appreciated, involvement of a project manager and technical experts ensures high-quality delivery and facilitates you to maintain a steep learning curve. We believe in diverse teams and diverse profiles in our Data & AI team. Some of our Data Scientists develop to be great consultants with technical knowledge and execution power, while others focus more on gaining deep technical expertise to deliver value from there. Working on a different range of projects in different sectors, you’ll be able to find your own sweet spot.

In addition, we believe that a caring and fun working environment will help you to dare to step out of your comfort zone and learn. We offer continuous learning through the IG&H Academy, in which you will get trainings to boost your data science, consulting and people skills. Also, you will be assigned a mentor, who will be there for you to provide you with guidance.

Above all, people are at the heart of what we do. This of course comes back in the work we deliver for our clients (why make a data product if the people who need to use it do not understand or want to use it?). At the same time, a fun working culture is key for who we are. With an inspiring office in Utrecht where we can connect, have abundant parties, team activities and sport events (both organized for the entire IG&H organization as well as specifically for the Data & Analytics team), IG&H is truly a Great Place To Work. And yes, we are certified!

Working for the Data & AI Team at IG&H Consulting is incredibly diverse, and fun at the same time. It’s been a great place to develop my technical know-how, management consulting skills and commercial effectivity. The team is young and ambitious, with a strong desire to solve complex puzzles, develop personally & professionally and do fun activities together. All in all, IG&H has been a great place to work for over 6 years already!

Lars van Kempen – Manager Data & AI

What you bring:

2+ years of relevant working experience at (among others) management consultancy firms, other professional services firms, and/or corporate data & AI teams
Python skills
Analytical, inventive and practical
A passion for Data & AI and the capability to translate business needs into impactful solutions
Drive to work in a fast-changing and high-demand, innovative environment
MSc degree, preferably in a technical field: e.g. Data Science, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Econometrics
You have excellent oral and written communication skills in Dutch and English

What we offer:

An opportunity to help clients to transform to become data-driven and make an impact through data & analytics
Working at a Great Place to Work with a pleasant atmosphere, enthusiastic colleagues who support you, where we put people first and encourage new initiatives
Working with exciting new (disruptive) technologies and international teams
Smart collaboration with talented consultants who will constructively challenge you
Company car / good mobility scheme
Permanent contract
The possibility to work parttime (32 hours), at least 4 days a week
25 holiday days with the possibility to take up five more
The possibility to take a sabbatical after 3 years of employment
IG&H facilitates a ‘"Health Human” program, where you get guidance with all adjustments in life after having a child
Generous bonus scheme
And more, which we would love to elaborate on

WHY IG&H?

IG&H is transforming leading companies across the Health, Retail and Finance sectors.

Together with our world-class technology partners, we help our clients move forward and stay relevant. With insightful advice, great design and unrivalled digital platforms. Our exceptional results come from successfully aligning people, business and technology.

With over 300 talented colleagues on board, people who genuinely embrace change and challenges, we’ve created a unique high-daring, high-caring culture. Attracting extraordinary people and inspiring them to push the boundaries for themselves and our clients.

If this vacancy is right for you, then this is a great place to work, with super happy employees and clients. We’re still just embarking on this exciting adventure. Why not be part of it?

We’re truly committed to diversifying our workforce and actively encourage women to apply for this role!

Moreover, we want our employees to reflect the diversity of society. We work together with a remarkable mix of talents, personalities and cultures. IG&H is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to national origin, race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetics, disability or age. We care about individuality, but most importantly, we share the pride of our collective achievements and a Great Place to Work.

Show more

Together with our world-class technology partners, we help our clients move forward and stay relevant. With insightful advice, great design and unrivalled digital platforms. Our exceptional results come from successfully aligning people, business and technology.

With over 300 talented colleagues on board, people who genuinely embrace change and challenges, we’ve created a unique high-daring, high-caring culture. Attracting extraordinary people and inspiring them to push the boundaries for themselves and our clients.

Title: Biological Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

The Company

Syngenta is a leading developer and producer of seeds. We bring farmers more vigorous, stronger, resistant plants, including innovative hybrid varieties and biotech crops that can thrive even in challenging growing conditions. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture.

For a new opening in the team, we are looking for a:

Biological Data Scientist

Job Description

Into Action

Are you ready to make a significant impact in the agricultural industry? Look no further! The Vegetable Seed Enhancement Team (VSET) at Syngenta is seeking a highly motivated and talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. As a Data Scientist at VSET, you will be an integral part of a multidisciplinary team, working closely with stakeholders across the vegetable business. Your primary focus will be on designing and implementing imaging technologies, algorithms, and artificial intelligence systems. By automating measurements and leveraging AI, you will gain a deep understanding of seed physiology and develop data-based solutions for the challenges faced by the global vegetable business.

The Challenge

When you are established in your role, you will work with the VSET team to;


Automate seed and plant measurements, developing algorithms for predicting seed performance.
Combine expertise in image analysis, machine learning, seed physiology, and biological experimentation.
Lead implementation and technology transfer to processing sites.
Actively participate in Syngenta's network of imaging and AI technologies.


Qualifications

Your Profile


To succeed in this role, you preferably have a Ph.D. or MSc degree with 3+ years of experience in machine learning and artificial intelligence or equivalent qualifications.
You are familiar with machine/deep learning frameworks, such as TensorFlow, Keras, and PyTorch.
Experience in deploying image analysis pipelines on the edge or in the cloud would be advantageous.
It would be a big plus if you have a strong interest in developing skills in chemometrics, spectroscopy, hyperspectral imaging, and establish a strong basic understanding of seed and plant biology.
You have good communication skills to interact with diverse internal stakeholders.
You are willing to work in Enkhuizen on a fulltime basis.


We will take care of a great onboarding, to make sure you feel comfortable and have all the necessary tools to start your new challenge.

Additional Information

Your Chance!

Join us at Syngenta and be part of a diverse and inclusive team that is passionate about shaping the future of sustainable agriculture. We offer a competitive salary package, excellent benefits and ample opportunities for professional growth and development.

If you recognize yourself in the profile and would like to apply for this position, please apply online via www.syngenta.com If you would like to have more information about this vacancy please contact our recruiter Nienke Terluin by email to nienke.terluin@syngenta.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are seeking a Data Scientist with expertise in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Large Language Models (LLM). The ideal candidate should have a solid foundation in machine learning fundamentals and a passion for deriving insights from unstructured text data.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement NLP models and algorithms.
Work with Large Language Models to enhance text-based applications.
Apply machine learning techniques to solve business problems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data-driven solutions.

Required Skills:

Proficiency in NLP and working with LLMs.
Basic understanding of machine learning concepts and techniques.
Strong programming skills in Python or R.

Experience with data manipulation and processing

Show more

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement NLP models and algorithms.
  • Work with Large Language Models to enhance text-based applications.
  • Apply machine learning techniques to solve business problems.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data-driven solutions.

Required Skills:

  • Proficiency in NLP and working with LLMs.
  • Basic understanding of machine learning concepts and techniques.
  • Strong programming skills in Python or R.

Experience with data manipulation and processing

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - LLM
Description:
LLM - Python for Machine Learning

Experience: 2 - 15 Years

Location- Permanent Remote Anywhere in the world

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, 5 hours Mandatory overlap with PST

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years Mandatory

Mandatory Skills- Python: min 2 years, Python for Data Science: min 1 yr, Machine Learning: min 1 yr, PyTorch: min 1 yr, Keras: min 1 yr, Tensorflow: min 1 yr

Key skills: Python, ML, PyTorch, Keras, TensorFlow

Job Responsibilities


Develop, train, and deploy machine learning models using TensorFlow and/or PyTorch.
Implement machine learning models and preprocessing pipelines using Scikit-learn.
Apply supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, including SVM, Decision Trees, Random Forest, and k-NN, to solve complex problems.
Design and implement deep learning architectures such as CNNs, RNNs, GANs, and transfer learning models.
Explore and apply reinforcement learning techniques to enhance AI solutions.


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 2+ years of experience as a Python-focused Engineer.
1+ years of experience with Python-based frameworks for machine learning.
Proficiency in TensorFlow and/or PyTorch for model development and deployment.
Strong knowledge of Scikit-learn for machine learning model implementation.
In-depth understanding of supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, as well as deep learning architectures.


Nice To Have


Experience with Keras for quick prototyping of deep learning models.
Proficiency in Pandas and Numpy for data manipulation and preprocessing.
Familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications in AI.
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills.


Skills: numpy,data science,deep learning,random forest,transfer learning,reinforcement learning,pytorch,gans,ml,scikit-learn,machine learning,svm,keras,cnns,unsupervised learning,k-nn,tensorflow,supervised learning,algorithms,ai,python,rnns,pandas,learning,large language models (llms),decision trees

Title: Data scientist, Den Haag
Description:
White Space Energy is a (so far quite successful) young startup founded by a team of seasoned Oil&Gas professionals. We use state of the art deep learning techniques to assist customers with complex decision making across a broad portfolio including, a.o., logistics, maintenance, portfolio analysis and well design. We address these decision-making challenges by simulating business environments as complex games and by developing game agents to master these. The policies of the game agents then provide insight in how to optimize the customer’s decision strategy.

We are looking for an enthusiastic data scientist who is interested in joining our team to help develop game environments and agents on consultancy projects. To succeed you will need to have a strong affinity with problem solving, be delivery focused, and will need knowledge of and experience in machine/deep learning, preferably reinforcement learning.

About You

We highly value strong machine / deep learning engineers willing to help out with whatever moves our projects forward. You should have strong interpersonal skills and be a team player, flexible in adapting to changing requirements and able to cope with and reduce ambiguity. An ability to quickly understand, augment, test, and debug unfamiliar systems is valuable. A demonstrated interest in reinforcement learning is required. You should be fluent in Python.

Minimum Qualifications


– BS degree in computer science, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, machine learning or equivalent (MSc/PhD preferable).
– Strong knowledge and experience of Python.
– Knowledge of machine / deep learning, in particular reinforcement learning.
– Strong knowledge of algorithm design.
– Working knowledge of TensorFlow.
– Experience with data analysis.
– Previous interest in playing with and/or creating simulation models is a plus.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
My client within the investment management sector are looking for an experienced data scientist to help build predictive models with a focus on sustainability and ESG risk!




Responsibilities:




• Designing new predictive models and refining existing models to analyze and forecast the mortgage market, with a focus on sustainability and ESG risks.

• Perform in-depth analyses that allow direct advice on portfolio management to our investors, with a balance between risk and return.

• Create innovative reports and whitepapers to share our findings with investors and stakeholders. You will also present these analyses yourself and discuss them with investors.

• Working with the wider team, providing investors with monthly information about their investment portfolio




Requirements:




• Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a related field (operations research, finance, econometrics, mathematics etc.)

• 2+ years of industry experience

• Knowledge of machine learning models is a plus

• Excellent quantitative modelling skills

• Strong command of the Dutch language




Salary Package:




• Up to €90,000 per annum (D.O.E)

• Travel allowance

• 2 days per week in the office

• Annual bonus.

• Pension plan

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences team is dedicated to empowering healthcare organizations ton achieve their goals and improve patient care. We aim to create an efficient and connected healthcare ecosystem by bringing the healthcare ecosystem together which empowers everyone across the healthcare journey to collaborate, communicate, and innovate together to provide better experiences for their workforces and patients or members alike.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:


Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch


Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:


This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
Experience with text summarization and/or text generation


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Utrecht Omgeving - Retail - Fulltime




Breng dit data team naar een hoger niveau met je expertise in ML/AI! en jij een expert in het benutten van AI/ML en kun je Data Scientists helpen bij het ontwikkelen en onderhouden van productieklare modellen? Als ML Engineer ben je onderdeel van het data analytics team voor een grote retailer in Nederland. Jij bent de specialist in MLOps en Cloud Computing, verantwoordelijk voor het productieklaar maken van AI/ML-oplossingen. Hiermee sla je de brug tussen de Data Scientists en de technologie (Azure/Databricks). Samen met je collega's (data scientists, consultants, analisten en engineers) werk je aan uiteenlopende projecten op het gebied van forecasting, logistiek, assortimentsoptimalisatie, e-commerce en CRM.




Werkzaamheden:




Je werkt samen met het Data Science-team om sterke AI/ML-modellen te creëren, waarbij je zorgt voor grondige monitoring van de proces-, data- en modelkwaliteit om fouten en verkeerde voorspellingen te voorkomen.
Je biedt advies en oplossingen voor technische uitdagingen die zich tijdens het ontwikkelingsproces voordoen.
Als specialist in MLOps en CI/CD onderhoud en verbeter je continu de modellen.
Je fungeert als verbindingspersoon tussen Data Science en Global IT voor het gebruik van technologieën zoals Databricks en Azure, die door Global IT worden beheerd.
Je draagt actief bij aan de vooruitgang van technologie en tools door het ontwikkelen van utility packages en het verder ontwikkelen van MLOps-methodologie.
Je blijft op de hoogte van innovaties binnen MLOps en bepaalt hoe deze kunnen bijdragen aan de doelen.







Wat zit erin voor jou?




Een dynamische omgeving waarin je veel kunt leren en plezier hebt door verantwoordelijkheid, vrijheid en ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Een competitief salaris, afhankelijk van jouw ervaring en opleiding
24 vakantiedagen en extra dagen op fulltime basis.
Mogelijkheid tot 19 extra vakantiedagen + mogelijkheid tot kopen of verkopen van vakantiedagen
Korting bij de retailer zelf
Leer- en doorgroeimogelijkheden met een interne academy.
2-3 dagen per week vanuit huis kunnen werken, flexibele uren
Kilometer vergoeding voor reis naar het kantoor.




Wie ben jij?

3+ jaar ervaring als ML Engineer of Data Scientist met affiniteit voor ML
Expertise in Python, PySpark en SQL
Ervaring met MLOps/ CI/CD cyclus en Git
Werken in scrumteams
Kennis van Databricks en Azure
Teamspirit en kunnen sparren met je collega's om zo mogelijke oplossingen voor te leggen.
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels




Ben jij de juiste fit? Neem nu contact op :)

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Kom werken bij CloudNation, waar we de kracht van data en AI benutten om industrieën te innoveren en te transformeren. We zijn een dynamisch team van gedreven professionals, ondernemers en tech-enthousiastelingen die zich inzetten voor het leveren van baanbrekende oplossingen.




Functieomschrijving:

We zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde Machine Learning Engineer om ons snelgroeiende AI-team te versterken. Bij CloudNation helpen we onze klanten om hun weg te vinden in het complexe en snel evoluerende AI-landschap.




Het aanbod:

Bruto maandsalaris tussen de €4.000,- en €5.500,-

Bij hard werken hoort een passende beloning. Dat snappen we bij CloudNation goed. Daarom krijg je bij ons een 'rebel package' met de volgende perks:

The usual: Een goed salaris dat past bij je verantwoordelijkheden, skills en ervaring plus laptop en telefoon van de zaak. Je mag kiezen: MacBook, Windows, iPhone, Android.
Ook goed geregeld: Mobiliteitsbudget, pensioen, thuiswerkvergoeding, studiebudget.
Work hard, play harder: Je krijgt van ons 26 vakantiedagen + 1 extra per 6 maanden niet ziek (2 extra dus totaal 28), omdat we vrije tijd voor dingen waar je écht blij van wordt ook belangrijk vinden.
Bij CloudNation hanteren wij hybride werken: dat betekent een combinatie tussen werken op kantoor, bij de klant en thuiswerken. Workation is in goed overleg ook mogelijk.
Samenwerken en plezier hebben: AWS en Azure dagen op woensdag en maandag. Ook belangrijk: een grote keuken voorzien van alle gemakken om samen te lunchen. Vanaf 16.00
uur borreltijd!
Nog meer plezier: Elke laatste vrijdag van de maand houden we de Grote CloudNation Vrijmibo! Met snacks, drinken en zo veel mogelijk CloudNation rebel's aanwezig.
TGIF: Elke vrijdagochtend worden er een virtuele meetings gehouden m.b.t. Share & Inspire en Deep Dive. En de week wordt afgesloten met wederom borreltijd.
En veel meer: bedrijfsuitjes naar de sneeuw of Berlijn, tafelvoetbal, darten, gamen, om mee te spelen en vrij in te vullen, company funded, teambuilding activiteiten.




Belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden:

Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van op Python gebaseerde back-enddiensten (FastAPI).
Betrokken zijn bij het bouwen en gebruiken van REST API's.
Samenwerken aan machine learning-projecten, inclusief het implementeren van modellen en het integreren van AI/ML-functionaliteiten.
Deelnemen aan de volledige ontwikkelingscyclus, inclusief ontwerp, codering, testen en productie-implementatie.
Werken in een teamomgeving om nieuwe ideeën te bedenken en bestaande processen te verbeteren.
Communiceren met klanten.




Gewenste vaardigheden:

Ervaring met frontend-ontwikkeling in React en TypeScript is een pluspunt.
Ervaring met data-engineering.
Bekendheid met Docker, microservices-architecturen en cloudomgevingen.
Kennis van Large Language Models (LLM's) en machine learning-frameworks.




Kwalificaties, jij hebt:

2-5 jaar ervaring en een achtergrond in software engineering (backend focus).
Ervaring met RAG/agentic applicaties
Ervaring met (web) engineering
ML/DS staat op tweede plek ten opzichte van de web engineering skill set
Een bachelor in informatica of aanverwante gebieden, of gelijkwaardige praktische ervaring.
Sterke probleemoplossende vaardigheden en het vermogen om samen te werken in een team.
Een ondernemende instelling en de bereidheid om verantwoordelijkheid te nemen voor je werk.
Het vermogen om snel nieuwe technologieën te begrijpen.
Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.




Onze stack is op dit moment:

Backend: Python (FastAPI) (belangrijk)
Azure, AWS, Docker, GitHub Actions
Frontend: TypeScript (React) (geen must, ervaring wel een plus)
Show more

Kom werken bij CloudNation, waar we de kracht van data en AI benutten om industrieën te innoveren en te transformeren. We zijn een dynamisch team van gedreven professionals, ondernemers en tech-enthousiastelingen die zich inzetten voor het leveren van baanbrekende oplossingen.


Functieomschrijving:

We zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde Machine Learning Engineer om ons snelgroeiende AI-team te versterken. Bij CloudNation helpen we onze klanten om hun weg te vinden in het complexe en snel evoluerende AI-landschap.


Het aanbod:

Bruto maandsalaris tussen de €4.000,- en €5.500,-

Bij hard werken hoort een passende beloning. Dat snappen we bij CloudNation goed. Daarom krijg je bij ons een 'rebel package' met de volgende perks:

  • The usual: Een goed salaris dat past bij je verantwoordelijkheden, skills en ervaring plus laptop en telefoon van de zaak. Je mag kiezen: MacBook, Windows, iPhone, Android.
  • Ook goed geregeld: Mobiliteitsbudget, pensioen, thuiswerkvergoeding, studiebudget.
  • Work hard, play harder: Je krijgt van ons 26 vakantiedagen + 1 extra per 6 maanden niet ziek (2 extra dus totaal 28), omdat we vrije tijd voor dingen waar je écht blij van wordt ook belangrijk vinden.
  • Bij CloudNation hanteren wij hybride werken: dat betekent een combinatie tussen werken op kantoor, bij de klant en thuiswerken. Workation is in goed overleg ook mogelijk.
  • Samenwerken en plezier hebben: AWS en Azure dagen op woensdag en maandag. Ook belangrijk: een grote keuken voorzien van alle gemakken om samen te lunchen. Vanaf 16.00
  • uur borreltijd!
  • Nog meer plezier: Elke laatste vrijdag van de maand houden we de Grote CloudNation Vrijmibo! Met snacks, drinken en zo veel mogelijk CloudNation rebel's aanwezig.
  • TGIF: Elke vrijdagochtend worden er een virtuele meetings gehouden m.b.t. Share & Inspire en Deep Dive. En de week wordt afgesloten met wederom borreltijd.
  • En veel meer: bedrijfsuitjes naar de sneeuw of Berlijn, tafelvoetbal, darten, gamen, om mee te spelen en vrij in te vullen, company funded, teambuilding activiteiten.


Belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden:

  • Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van op Python gebaseerde back-enddiensten (FastAPI).
  • Betrokken zijn bij het bouwen en gebruiken van REST API's.
  • Samenwerken aan machine learning-projecten, inclusief het implementeren van modellen en het integreren van AI/ML-functionaliteiten.
  • Deelnemen aan de volledige ontwikkelingscyclus, inclusief ontwerp, codering, testen en productie-implementatie.
  • Werken in een teamomgeving om nieuwe ideeën te bedenken en bestaande processen te verbeteren.
  • Communiceren met klanten.


Gewenste vaardigheden:

  • Ervaring met frontend-ontwikkeling in React en TypeScript is een pluspunt.
  • Ervaring met data-engineering.
  • Bekendheid met Docker, microservices-architecturen en cloudomgevingen.
  • Kennis van Large Language Models (LLM's) en machine learning-frameworks.


Kwalificaties, jij hebt:

  • 2-5 jaar ervaring en een achtergrond in software engineering (backend focus).
  • Ervaring met RAG/agentic applicaties
  • Ervaring met (web) engineering
  • ML/DS staat op tweede plek ten opzichte van de web engineering skill set
  • Een bachelor in informatica of aanverwante gebieden, of gelijkwaardige praktische ervaring.
  • Sterke probleemoplossende vaardigheden en het vermogen om samen te werken in een team.
  • Een ondernemende instelling en de bereidheid om verantwoordelijkheid te nemen voor je werk.
  • Het vermogen om snel nieuwe technologieën te begrijpen.
  • Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.


Onze stack is op dit moment:

  • Backend: Python (FastAPI) (belangrijk)
  • Azure, AWS, Docker, GitHub Actions
  • Frontend: TypeScript (React) (geen must, ervaring wel een plus)

Title: AI Developer
Description:
We’re seeking a visionary AI Developer to pioneer the integration of cutting-edge artificial intelligence into our flagship software, Cleopatra. If you’re ready to shape the future of enterprise software and lead the charge in AI innovation, we want to hear from you!




As an AI Developer at Cleopatra Enterprise, you will be at the forefront of transforming Cleopatra into an AI-powered solution that delivers unparalleled value to our clients. This is a pioneer role where you will have the opportunity to shape the direction of AI development within our organization. We are looking for someone who can take the initiative in the AI field, spot opportunities for innovation, and drive impactful projects from conception to implementation.




You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for leveraging AI technologies, design and develop machine learning models and algorithms, and implement AI-driven features that enhance user experience and provide actionable insights. This is an exciting opportunity to work on challenging projects, contribute to groundbreaking innovations, and shape the future of enterprise software.




In addition to being at the forefront of AI innovation, joining Cleopatra Enterprise means immersing yourself in a vibrant and diverse culture. With employees representing 20 different nationalities, our team thrives on the richness of varied perspectives and experiences. Our team members are highly educated and passionate about their work, creating an atmosphere of continuous learning and growth.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
1-2 years of experience in developing AI solutions
Proficiency in Python, Java is a plus
Understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithms, including supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, Large Language Models and reinforcement learning.
Hands-on experience with popular machine learning frameworks and libraries, such as TensorFlow and PyTorch,
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
Effective communication and collaboration skills.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences team is dedicated to empowering healthcare organizations ton achieve their goals and improve patient care. We aim to create an efficient and connected healthcare ecosystem by bringing the healthcare ecosystem together which empowers everyone across the healthcare journey to collaborate, communicate, and innovate together to provide better experiences for their workforces and patients or members alike.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:


Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch


Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:


This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
Experience with text summarization and/or text generation


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Overview: Data Scientist

As a Data Scientist on the System Driven Remediation Team, you will ensure our client's risk models are supported by high-quality, reliable data. You will source, analyze, and remediate data to meet the standards required for Risk Weighted Assets (RWA) calculations and other risk-related metrics, directly impacting our client's ability to optimize their capital position and financial goals.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis and Modeling: Develop datasets from raw data, ensuring quality, traceability, and suitability for risk modeling. Analyze data to identify trends and anomalies affecting risk assessments.
Data Quality Remediation: Identify and correct data quality issues by creating and implementing remediation processes, ensuring data is accurate and fit-for-purpose.
Technical Solutions Development: Propose, document, and implement technical solutions for data remediation, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards.
Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with stakeholders in Corporate Banking and Credit Data Domains to resolve data quality and availability issues, and propose alternative data sources and methods to fill data gaps.
Project Leadership: Lead data remediation projects, ensuring alignment with regulatory requirements and organizational goals.
Regulatory Compliance Support: Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, such as the A-IRB license, through effective data management practices.
Continuous Improvement: Share insights and drive continuous improvement in data quality and risk management processes.




Ideal Candidate:

Strong skills in data analysis, modeling, and quality management.
Experience in data remediation and project leadership.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Familiarity with risk modeling, regulatory requirements, and financial services data.
Ability to work collaboratively and drive data-driven decision-making.




Apply via the link or email rakim.newton@glocomms.com

Show more
HTML:
Job Overview: Data Scientist

As a Data Scientist on the System Driven Remediation Team, you will ensure our client's risk models are supported by high-quality, reliable data. You will source, analyze, and remediate data to meet the standards required for Risk Weighted Assets (RWA) calculations and other risk-related metrics, directly impacting our client's ability to optimize their capital position and financial goals.

Key Responsibilities:

  1. Data Analysis and Modeling: Develop datasets from raw data, ensuring quality, traceability, and suitability for risk modeling. Analyze data to identify trends and anomalies affecting risk assessments.
  2. Data Quality Remediation: Identify and correct data quality issues by creating and implementing remediation processes, ensuring data is accurate and fit-for-purpose.
  3. Technical Solutions Development: Propose, document, and implement technical solutions for data remediation, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards.
  4. Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with stakeholders in Corporate Banking and Credit Data Domains to resolve data quality and availability issues, and propose alternative data sources and methods to fill data gaps.
  5. Project Leadership: Lead data remediation projects, ensuring alignment with regulatory requirements and organizational goals.
  6. Regulatory Compliance Support: Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, such as the A-IRB license, through effective data management practices.
  7. Continuous Improvement: Share insights and drive continuous improvement in data quality and risk management processes.


Ideal Candidate:

  • Strong skills in data analysis, modeling, and quality management.
  • Experience in data remediation and project leadership.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
  • Familiarity with risk modeling, regulatory requirements, and financial services data.
  • Ability to work collaboratively and drive data-driven decision-making.


Apply via the link or email rakim.newton@glocomms.com

Title: Artificial Intelligence Specialist
Description:
For a growing project with one of our most international customers, we are seeking a talented and motivated AI Expert to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and data analysis. This role involves developing AI models, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and applying advanced AI techniques to solve complex problems in IoT and instrumentation systems.




Responsibilities

Develop and implement AI models and algorithms for various applications.

Collaborate with engineering and data science teams to integrate AI solutions into our products.

Analyse large datasets to extract meaningful insights and improve decision-making processes.

Design and conduct experiments to validate AI models and optimize their performance.

Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning technologies.

Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior team members.

Communicate complex AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Location: Amsterdam, The Netherlands




Candidate Description

Master’s or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.

Proven experience in developing and deploying AI models and algorithms.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Knowledge of IoT systems and instrumentation is a plus.




Benefits

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Collaborative and innovative work environment.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.
Access to the latest tools and technologies.
plenty of learning opportunities.
Show more

HTML:
Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences team is dedicated to empowering healthcare organizations ton achieve their goals and improve patient care. We aim to create an efficient and connected healthcare ecosystem by bringing the healthcare ecosystem together which empowers everyone across the healthcare journey to collaborate, communicate, and innovate together to provide better experiences for their workforces and patients or members alike.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:

  • Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
  • Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
  • Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
  • Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
  • Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
  • Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.

Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications

  • Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
  • Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
  • Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
  • Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch

Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:

  • This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

Preferred/Additional Qualifications

  • Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
  • Experience with text summarization and/or text generation

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
My client within the biotech sector are seeking a senior data scientist to join their dynamic and fast growing team,




Responsibilities

Analyze data from single-cell transcriptomics experiments. Occasionally also other (transcript)omics datasets.
Work closely with our clients to understand their biological question and help them interpret the data we generate for them.
Keep track of and manage your projects. Work with our sales team to scope out projects and advise clients on next steps.
Build products & workflows: You will help in building new workflows and pipelines for the development of new data analysis services.
Research: You will (occasionally) work on internal R&D projects by supporting the data interpretation of new technologies and services our company develops.

Your skills & background

A MSc or PhD working on (single-cell) sequencing or closely related discipline.
You have 1-3 years of experience with single-cell sequencing data science.
Fluent in R or Python. Comfortable in a Linux environment.
You are very familiar with Seurat, ScanPy or other single-cell analysis methods.
Experience with wet-lab experiments or experimental design is a plus.
You have a flexible mindset and adapt quickly to changing environments.
You perform well while managing different projects and tight deadlines.
You master the English language (both orally and in writing) and can explain and communicate results efficiently.
You are a team player and enjoy working with other (data) scientists.




Salary Package:

up to €90,000 per annum
Flexible holiday allowance
Flexible hybrid working arrangements




Apply now and be a part of this exciting journey!

Show more

Salary Package:

  • Flexible holiday allowance
  • Flexible hybrid working arrangements


Apply now and be a part of this exciting journey!

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Word jij onze nieuwe collega?

Heb jij een passie voor data-analyse en wil je bijdragen aan innovatieve oplossingen binnen de accountancy? BGH | Rademaker zoekt een Data Scientist om ons dynamische team te versterken. Als Data Scientist bij ons jonge en energieke accountantskantoor speel je een cruciale rol bij het ontwikkelen en implementeren van geavanceerde data-modellen.

Wat ga je doen?

  • Je werkt zelfstandig of in teamverband aan uitdagende data science-projecten voor diverse klanten;
  • Je onderzoekt complexe datasets met behulp van SQL en Python, waardoor je in staat bent om trends en patronen te identificeren;
  • Je werkt nauw samen met interne belanghebbenden om zakelijke uitdagingen te begrijpen en op maat gemaakte data-oplossingen te bieden;
  • Je ontwikkelt en implementeert voorspellende modellen voor financiële prognoses en risicobeheer om strategische besluitvorming te ondersteunen;
  • Je draagt bij aan het verbeteren van data-analyseprocessen en -infrastructuren om de leidende positie van ons accountantskantoor in de branche te versterken.


Dit ben jij;

Naast passie voor het vak en een proactieve, teamgerichte en integere werkhouding, beschik je over:

  • Een HBO of WO achtergrond in Data Science, Statistiek, Computerwetenschappen of vergelijkbaar;
  • Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist;
  • Uitgebreide kennis van en ervaring met SQL en Python. Ervaring met Power BI is een pré;
  • Sterke analytische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels


Fijne arbeidsvoorwaarden en een goed salaris

  • Een uitdagende functie voor 32-40 uur per week;
  • Een competitief salaris en aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden;
  • 27 vakantiedagen en een goede pensioenregeling;
  • Een laptop en thuiswerkvergoeding;
  • De mogelijkheid om jezelf persoonlijk en professioneel te ontwikkelen.


De mensen maken het bedrijf. Bij BGH zijn we blij met al onze collega’s en die waardering spreken we ook uit. Plezier in je werk vinden we namelijk het allerbelangrijkste. We verzetten samen het werk. We hebben oog voor elkaar én voor onze klanten. De sfeer is goed en je krijgt veel vrijheid om je eigen werk in te delen. We stimuleren persoonlijke ontwikkeling op basis van jouw eigen doelen en wensen. Kortom, bij BGH ben je verzekerd van leuke en behulpzame collega’s, uitdagende opdrachten en uiteenlopende klanten.

Interesse?

Solliciteer direct via onderstaande button!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Key Responsibilities:


Financial Economic Crime (FEC) and Customer Due Diligence (CDD): Work on critical topics that significantly impact Rabobank’s operations, helping to prevent financial crimes and streamline processes for non-risky customers.
Azure Infrastructure Development: Develop, manage, and maintain high-performance machine learning and AI infrastructure on Azure.
Collaboration: Work in a multidisciplinary team to develop scalable solutions and ML pipelines, collaborating closely with teams and data scientists.
System and Model Health: Ensure the health of systems and models by monitoring data quality, performance, and business impact, and devising mitigation plans.
Issue Identification: Identify underlying issues and opportunities across the ML development cycle, introducing tools for efficient development and testing.
Solution Implementation: Implement solutions in alignment with architectural guidelines, collaborating effectively with your team.
Continuous Learning: Stay up to date with the latest technologies to continuously evolve your craft.


RequirementsRequired Skills:


Education: A completed relevant HBO or WO education.
Experience: Minimum 4 years of relevant experience in Software, Data, or ML Engineering, with at least 2 years specifically in ML Engineering working with large data sets using Python and PySpark (experience with Azure Databricks is a plus).
Software Development: Strong software development skills and good practices such as Git, release management, unit tests, and testing strategies.
Cloud Environment: Experience working in a cloud environment, preferably Azure.
Collaboration: Ability to collaborate with data scientists and machine learning practitioners to provide infrastructure support for model development and deployment.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical mind, customer-oriented, driven, and a true team player eager to learn new techniques and developments.
