  • Collaboration: Work in a multidisciplinary team to develop scalable solutions and ML pipelines, collaborating closely with teams and data scientists.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist / ML engineer / Amsterdam / Hybrid




A large enterprise customer of ours is undergoing a transformation specifically aimed at growth and marketing area. They are seeking a talented Data Scientist to come on board and offer their expertise in a brand new greenfield assignment amongst a multi-disciplinary teams







The purpose of this area is to create customer demand, engagement, and loyalty with the brand by amplifying the commercial offer and we need predictive modelling for marketing and growth!







You will need:




5+ years of Data Science experience at enterprise level
Predictive modelling, statistics and Machine learning experience
Python
BigQuery




Desirable:




LLM (Large language models)
Generative AI exposure







Details:




4 month initial contract - view to extend in January - (its a 2 year project)
Self employed rate €80 - 85 per hour / 40 hours a week
Payroll salary = €7000 - 8000 a month
1 day a week in Amsterdam / 4 days remote







Apply today for a further discussion!

Title: Data Scientist I (Credit Risk)
Description:
At a glance

Do you like a job with plenty of variety? Are you interested in data, programming, Risk and stakeholder management? Do you want to work in a dynamic and multidisciplinary team, and are you keen to share your knowledge? If so, take a look at the vacancy of Modelling Data Analyst (Non Retail /Credit Risk)!

We are constantly looking for ways to improve we manage our risks. Risk Models play a pivotal role in this. These models rely on accurate data supplied by our Modelling Data Teams as part of ABN AMRO’s Finance and Risk Business Grid. We are looking for experienced, fast learning Non Retail Modelling Data Analysts who like to translate credit risk data requirements to reliable modelling data sets and are eager to contribute making our data collection processes future proof.

Your job

As a member of the Non Retail Modelling Consuming Dataset team, you supply Credit Risk Modelling with the data they need to compile risk models. On one hand your duties will consist of technical aspects such as SQL and Python programming, performing Data Quality analyses and integrating datasets. On the other hand you’ll be working on documentation and using your communicative skills for stakeholder alignment. You also play an active role in the frequent team meetings where knowledge-sharing and transparency on progress is key.

Working environment

The Finance & Risk Data Domain is part of Finance & Risk Business Grids (F&RBG), and plays an active role for all the Finance and Risk departments. We employ 250+ international professionals with different backgrounds who are driven to bring risk data management to a structurally higher level. Our aim is to generate reliable risk data on time. We do this by improving the risk data itself, data systems and data processes. We work with an Agile operating model. Our Finance and Risk Data Domain consists of 5 teams where the atmosphere is dynamic, open and informal.

The Non Retail Consumer Data set team is part of the Value Delivery Consuming Dataset cluster which is primarily responsible for supplying data for developing, monitoring and calibrating risk models. You will be working in a team that largely consist of highly motivated colleagues with international backgrounds, working in an open and informal atmosphere. Given the importance the regulatory authorities ascribe to modelling and the data underpinning it, this is a challenging and impactful role.

Your profile

Your ability and willingness to work with others is crucial for your success in this role. You are naturally someone who takes initiative, structures and organizes work well and is keen to work with others to deliver tangible results. You are practical, have an analytical approach and good communication and presentation skills. You are a strong team player and you take responsibility for your work. In the dynamic environment in which you operate, you have the ability to get all stakeholders on board.

You also have the following qualifications and skills:


a Master’s degree, preferably a beta study
highly skilled in SQL and Python
familiar with Azure DevOps, Boards and GIT repos.
experience with Agile way of working
the ability to detail and challenge data requirements
experienced with Data Management and Data Governance principles
knowledge of risk management in banking or financial institutions
excellent verbal and written communications skills
good stakeholder management skills
knowledge of Risk regulations like BCBS239, Perdarr, Basel IV or IFRS
you are eligible to work in the EU



We are offering


The gross monthly salary displayed above is based on a 36-hour work week, including vacation pay and benefit budget.
The Benefit Budget is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month.
Five weeks of vacation per year. You have the option to purchase an additional four weeks per year.
Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3,000.
Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position).
An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
An excellent pension scheme.



Interested?

Does this sound like something you’d be interested in? Send us your application as soon as possible. We very much look forward meeting you.

Equal opportunities for all

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

Disclaimer external recruitment agencies

External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

Wij vragen


Samenwerkingsgerichtheid



Wij bieden


Analytische skills

You also play an active role in the frequent team meetings where knowledge-sharing and transparency on progress is key.

The Finance & Risk Data Domain is part of Finance & Risk Business Grids (F&RBG), and plays an active role for all the Finance and Risk departments. We employ 250+ international professionals with different backgrounds who are driven to bring risk data management to a structurally higher level. Our aim is to generate reliable risk data on time. We do this by improving the risk data itself, data systems and data processes. We work with an Agile operating model. Our Finance and Risk Data Domain consists of 5 teams where the atmosphere is dynamic, open and informal.

The Non Retail Consumer Data set team is part of the Value Delivery Consuming Dataset cluster which is primarily responsible for supplying data for developing, monitoring and calibrating risk models. You will be working in a team that largely consist of highly motivated colleagues with international backgrounds, working in an open and informal atmosphere. Given the importance the regulatory authorities ascribe to modelling and the data underpinning it, this is a challenging and impactful role.

Your profile

Your ability and willingness to work with others is crucial for your success in this role. You are naturally someone who takes initiative, structures and organizes work well and is keen to work with others to deliver tangible results. You are practical, have an analytical approach and good communication and presentation skills. You are a strong team player and you take responsibility for your work. In the dynamic environment in which you operate, you have the ability to get all stakeholders on board.

You also have the following qualifications and skills:

  • a Master’s degree, preferably a beta study
  • highly skilled in SQL and Python
  • familiar with Azure DevOps, Boards and GIT repos.
  • experience with Agile way of working
  • the ability to detail and challenge data requirements
  • experienced with Data Management and Data Governance principles
  • knowledge of risk management in banking or financial institutions
  • excellent verbal and written communications skills
  • good stakeholder management skills
  • knowledge of Risk regulations like BCBS239, Perdarr, Basel IV or IFRS
  • you are eligible to work in the EU


We are offering

  • The gross monthly salary displayed above is based on a 36-hour work week, including vacation pay and benefit budget.
  • The Benefit Budget is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month.
  • Five weeks of vacation per year. You have the option to purchase an additional four weeks per year.
  • Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3,000.
  • Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position).
  • An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
  • An excellent pension scheme.


Interested?

Does this sound like something you’d be interested in? Send us your application as soon as possible. We very much look forward meeting you.

Equal opportunities for all

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

Disclaimer external recruitment agencies

External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

Wij vragen

  • Samenwerkingsgerichtheid


Wij bieden

  • Analytische skills

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Kom werken bij CloudNation, waar we de kracht van data en AI benutten om industrieën te innoveren en te transformeren. We zijn een dynamisch team van gedreven professionals, ondernemers en tech-enthousiastelingen die zich inzetten voor het leveren van baanbrekende oplossingen.




Functieomschrijving:

We zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde Machine Learning Engineer om ons snelgroeiende AI-team te versterken. Bij CloudNation helpen we onze klanten om hun weg te vinden in het complexe en snel evoluerende AI-landschap.




Het aanbod:

Bruto maandsalaris tussen de €4.000,- en €5.500,-

Bij hard werken hoort een passende beloning. Dat snappen we bij CloudNation goed. Daarom krijg je bij ons een 'rebel package' met de volgende perks:

The usual: Een goed salaris dat past bij je verantwoordelijkheden, skills en ervaring plus laptop en telefoon van de zaak. Je mag kiezen: MacBook, Windows, iPhone, Android.
Ook goed geregeld: Mobiliteitsbudget, pensioen, thuiswerkvergoeding, studiebudget.
Work hard, play harder: Je krijgt van ons 26 vakantiedagen + 1 extra per 6 maanden niet ziek (2 extra dus totaal 28), omdat we vrije tijd voor dingen waar je écht blij van wordt ook belangrijk vinden.
Bij CloudNation hanteren wij hybride werken: dat betekent een combinatie tussen werken op kantoor, bij de klant en thuiswerken. Workation is in goed overleg ook mogelijk.
Samenwerken en plezier hebben: AWS en Azure dagen op woensdag en maandag. Ook belangrijk: een grote keuken voorzien van alle gemakken om samen te lunchen. Vanaf 16.00
uur borreltijd!
Nog meer plezier: Elke laatste vrijdag van de maand houden we de Grote CloudNation Vrijmibo! Met snacks, drinken en zo veel mogelijk CloudNation rebel's aanwezig.
TGIF: Elke vrijdagochtend worden er een virtuele meetings gehouden m.b.t. Share & Inspire en Deep Dive. En de week wordt afgesloten met wederom borreltijd.
En veel meer: bedrijfsuitjes naar de sneeuw of Berlijn, tafelvoetbal, darten, gamen, om mee te spelen en vrij in te vullen, company funded, teambuilding activiteiten.




Belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden:

Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van op Python gebaseerde back-enddiensten (FastAPI).
Betrokken zijn bij het bouwen en gebruiken van REST API's.
Samenwerken aan machine learning-projecten, inclusief het implementeren van modellen en het integreren van AI/ML-functionaliteiten.
Deelnemen aan de volledige ontwikkelingscyclus, inclusief ontwerp, codering, testen en productie-implementatie.
Werken in een teamomgeving om nieuwe ideeën te bedenken en bestaande processen te verbeteren.
Communiceren met klanten.




Gewenste vaardigheden:

Ervaring met frontend-ontwikkeling in React en TypeScript is een pluspunt.
Ervaring met data-engineering.
Bekendheid met Docker, microservices-architecturen en cloudomgevingen.
Kennis van Large Language Models (LLM's) en machine learning-frameworks.




Kwalificaties, jij hebt:

2-5 jaar ervaring en een achtergrond in software engineering (backend focus).
Ervaring met RAG/agentic applicaties
Ervaring met (web) engineering
ML/DS staat op tweede plek ten opzichte van de web engineering skill set
Een bachelor in informatica of aanverwante gebieden, of gelijkwaardige praktische ervaring.
Sterke probleemoplossende vaardigheden en het vermogen om samen te werken in een team.
Een ondernemende instelling en de bereidheid om verantwoordelijkheid te nemen voor je werk.
Het vermogen om snel nieuwe technologieën te begrijpen.
Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.




Onze stack is op dit moment:

Backend: Python (FastAPI) (belangrijk)
Azure, AWS, Docker, GitHub Actions
Frontend: TypeScript (React) (geen must, ervaring wel een plus)
Show more

Title: AI Developer
Description:
We’re seeking a visionary AI Developer to pioneer the integration of cutting-edge artificial intelligence into our flagship software, Cleopatra. If you’re ready to shape the future of enterprise software and lead the charge in AI innovation, we want to hear from you!




As an AI Developer at Cleopatra Enterprise, you will be at the forefront of transforming Cleopatra into an AI-powered solution that delivers unparalleled value to our clients. This is a pioneer role where you will have the opportunity to shape the direction of AI development within our organization. We are looking for someone who can take the initiative in the AI field, spot opportunities for innovation, and drive impactful projects from conception to implementation.




You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for leveraging AI technologies, design and develop machine learning models and algorithms, and implement AI-driven features that enhance user experience and provide actionable insights. This is an exciting opportunity to work on challenging projects, contribute to groundbreaking innovations, and shape the future of enterprise software.




In addition to being at the forefront of AI innovation, joining Cleopatra Enterprise means immersing yourself in a vibrant and diverse culture. With employees representing 20 different nationalities, our team thrives on the richness of varied perspectives and experiences. Our team members are highly educated and passionate about their work, creating an atmosphere of continuous learning and growth.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
1-2 years of experience in developing AI solutions
Proficiency in Python, Java is a plus
Understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithms, including supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, Large Language Models and reinforcement learning.
Hands-on experience with popular machine learning frameworks and libraries, such as TensorFlow and PyTorch,
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
Effective communication and collaboration skills.

Show more

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences team is dedicated to empowering healthcare organizations ton achieve their goals and improve patient care. We aim to create an efficient and connected healthcare ecosystem by bringing the healthcare ecosystem together which empowers everyone across the healthcare journey to collaborate, communicate, and innovate together to provide better experiences for their workforces and patients or members alike.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:


Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch


Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:


This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
Experience with text summarization and/or text generation


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Does This Sound Like You?

You are an AI Engineer with a passion for Natural Language Processing (NLP) and large language models (LLMs). You thrive in a dynamic environment where you can bridge the gap between engineering and data science. With a pragmatic approach and strong problem-solving skills, you are adept at developing and optimizing AI solutions using AWS. You enjoy the challenge of working on innovative projects and are driven by the opportunity to make a significant impact with your expertise in AI technologies.

How You Will Add Value with AI at Sytac

At Sytac, we work with a diverse range of clients across various industries, all based in the Netherlands. We pride ourselves on delivering cutting-edge AI solutions for our clients that drive business transformation and innovation. Our team has tackled complex challenges such as developing advanced NLP models, optimizing large-scale AI deployments, and integrating AI solutions with AWS. We are excited about what we can achieve with your skills and expertise on board!

As we continue to grow and expand our AI capabilities, we offer you the chance to be part of a forward-thinking team that values your contributions and supports your professional development for our clients. You will have the opportunity to work on impactful projects, collaborate with a diverse team, and shape the future of AI solutions.

What You'll Be Doing;


AI Solution Development: Design and implement AI solutions using NLP and LLM technologies
AWS Integration: Utilize AWS services for deploying and managing AI models
Innovation Projects: Engage in Generative AI (GenAI) projects to drive innovation
Technical Leadership: Provide technical expertise and thought leadership in AI and machine learning
Continuous Learning: Use your development budget for ongoing learning and share knowledge through team sessions
Impactful Contributions: Play a key role in advancing our AI initiatives and enhancing our capabilities



What You'll Have


Technical Expertise:
Proven experience with NLP, LLMs, and AI technologies
Proficiency in Python and experience with AWS is preferred
Strong background in developing and optimizing AI solutions
Consulting & Communication Skills:
Demonstrated ability to solve complex problems with innovative AI solutions
Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Conditions:
Freelance or Full Time



About Sytac:

At Sytac, we’re on a mission to become the leading name in digital solutions. We aim to help Dutch companies stay ahead with the latest technology. We’re not just another IT company; we’re a lively team of tech enthusiasts dedicated to pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. Our success comes from our amazing team—people who love technology and are dedicated to being the best in everything we do.

Our goal is to be recognized as one of the top 10 tech partners and one of the top 25 employers for tech professionals. Join us as we work to make a real difference in the world of technology!

If you’re excited about leveraging your AI expertise to drive innovation and make a real impact, we’d love to hear from you!
Show more

Our goal is to be recognized as one of the top 10 tech partners and one of the top 25 employers for tech professionals. Join us as we work to make a real difference in the world of technology!

If you’re excited about leveraging your AI expertise to drive innovation and make a real impact, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences team is dedicated to empowering healthcare organizations ton achieve their goals and improve patient care. We aim to create an efficient and connected healthcare ecosystem by bringing the healthcare ecosystem together which empowers everyone across the healthcare journey to collaborate, communicate, and innovate together to provide better experiences for their workforces and patients or members alike.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:


Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch


Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:


This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
Experience with text summarization and/or text generation


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description:

This role is crucial in transforming vast amounts of data into actionable intelligence through advanced data science techniques and applied research. As a Data Scientist, you will be at the forefront of applying AI and machine learning methods to automate processes and develop predictive algorithms, ensuring operations are future-proof.




Responsibilities:

Data Science & Analysis: Provide insights into data analysis and data science opportunities. Conduct inventories and analyse available data. Apply data science methods to recognize patterns in large datasets.
Applied Research: Analyse and translate complex problems into actionable topics and plans.

Stay updated on (international) developments and assess their relevance. Formulate, test, and validate assumptions for applicability. Present and publish research findings internally.

Development of Data Products & Services: Identify and assess information needs for various projects. Coordinate and inform project teams on technical designs and implementations. Oversee the implementation of innovative data-driven solutions.




Requirements:

Required Qualifications:

-Bachelor’s and Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Biomedical Sciences, or a related field.

-At least 3 years of demonstrable experience with IT applications in an operational environment and/or in the migration and security sector.

-A minimum of 3 years of experience in computer science, AI, software engineering, data science, or a closely related field.

Preferred Qualifications

-Proven experience working collaboratively in IT project teams.

-Familiarity with data science tools and methodologies.

-Experience in data engineering.

-Previous experience as a technology watcher, staying ahead of emerging trends.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Word jij onze nieuwe collega?

Heb jij een passie voor data-analyse en wil je bijdragen aan innovatieve oplossingen binnen de accountancy? BGH | Rademaker zoekt een Data Scientist om ons dynamische team te versterken. Als Data Scientist bij ons jonge en energieke accountantskantoor speel je een cruciale rol bij het ontwikkelen en implementeren van geavanceerde data-modellen.

Wat ga je doen?

  • Je werkt zelfstandig of in teamverband aan uitdagende data science-projecten voor diverse klanten;
  • Je onderzoekt complexe datasets met behulp van SQL en Python, waardoor je in staat bent om trends en patronen te identificeren;
  • Je werkt nauw samen met interne belanghebbenden om zakelijke uitdagingen te begrijpen en op maat gemaakte data-oplossingen te bieden;
  • Je ontwikkelt en implementeert voorspellende modellen voor financiële prognoses en risicobeheer om strategische besluitvorming te ondersteunen;
  • Je draagt bij aan het verbeteren van data-analyseprocessen en -infrastructuren om de leidende positie van ons accountantskantoor in de branche te versterken.


Dit ben jij;

Naast passie voor het vak en een proactieve, teamgerichte en integere werkhouding, beschik je over:

  • Een HBO of WO achtergrond in Data Science, Statistiek, Computerwetenschappen of vergelijkbaar;
  • Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist;
  • Uitgebreide kennis van en ervaring met SQL en Python. Ervaring met Power BI is een pré;
  • Sterke analytische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels


Fijne arbeidsvoorwaarden en een goed salaris

  • Een uitdagende functie voor 32-40 uur per week;
  • Een competitief salaris en aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden;
  • 27 vakantiedagen en een goede pensioenregeling;
  • Een laptop en thuiswerkvergoeding;
  • De mogelijkheid om jezelf persoonlijk en professioneel te ontwikkelen.


De mensen maken het bedrijf. Bij BGH zijn we blij met al onze collega’s en die waardering spreken we ook uit. Plezier in je werk vinden we namelijk het allerbelangrijkste. We verzetten samen het werk. We hebben oog voor elkaar én voor onze klanten. De sfeer is goed en je krijgt veel vrijheid om je eigen werk in te delen. We stimuleren persoonlijke ontwikkeling op basis van jouw eigen doelen en wensen. Kortom, bij BGH ben je verzekerd van leuke en behulpzame collega’s, uitdagende opdrachten en uiteenlopende klanten.

Interesse?

Solliciteer direct via onderstaande button!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist

Als Senior Data Scientist (speaking dutch fluently) bij Ordina Sopra steria werk je aan gave uitdagende projecten in een divers team van collega-data scientisten. Jouw expertise en ambities vormen de basis voor onze High-Performance Teams (HPT's), waarin samenwerking en continue ontwikkeling centraal staan. Iedereen draagt bij vanuit zijn eigen vakmanschap en technologie. Zo blijf je van elkaar leren en sta je er dus nooit alleen voor. Gespecialiseerd in NLP en LLM's, sta je aan de frontlinie van het ontwikkelen en implementeren van geavanceerde NLP-oplossingen.




Werken als Senior Data Scientist bij Ordina Sopra steria

Je staat aan de frontlinie van het ontwikkelen en implementeren van geavanceerde NLP-oplossingen.
Je overbrugt de kloof tussen opkomende technologieën en zakelijke behoeften.
Je biedt begeleiding en mentorship aan collega's en klanten op jouw expertisegebieden.
Je brengt innovatieve ideeën in om het Data Science-team te versterken.
Je maakt gebruik van de meest recente machine learning modellen en deep learning algoritmes.




Waar jij komt te werken

Je komt terecht in een team van 20 data scientists die werken aan verschillende projecten, voornamelijk in multidisciplinaire teams bij verschillende organisaties. We werken aan een breed scala aan ML-projecten, en hebben een van de drie kernfocuspunten op Grote Taalmodellen. We onderzoeken, ontwikkelen en valideren grote taalmodel(len) (assets) zoals document intelligentie en zoeken en implementeren ze in productie bij onze klanten.




Het gebied bestaat uit vijf praktijken: Data Governance en Data Management, Data Visualisatie, Data Science en AI, Data Engineering en Data Migraties, en Ruimtelijke Intelligentie. Elk met een specifieke focus op inhoud en de juiste oplossing. Meer dan 170 professionals werken in een praktijk die logisch bij hen past. We geloven in de kracht van multidisciplinaire teams.




Dit ben jij

Je bent een enthousiaste professional in het veld van Natural Language Processing (NLP) en Large Language Models (LLM's). Als innovatieve denker ben je altijd op de hoogte van de nieuwste ontwikkelingen in de wereld van Generative AI. Je combineert technische expertise met een praktische aanpak, waarbij je niet aarzelt om complexe problemen aan te pakken, maar ook pragmatisch genoeg bent om eenvoudigere oplossingen te kiezen als die effectief zijn. Je bent een echte teamspeler die graag kennis deelt en discussieert over de laatste trends en inzichten in het vakgebied.




Kortom, je bent een gedreven NLP-specialist die het beste van twee werelden combineert: een diepgaande technische kennis van LLM's en GenAI, gekoppeld aan een praktische, resultaatgerichte benadering van probleemoplossing.




Verder neem je mee:

Bachelor en of masterdiploma
Minimaal 3-4 jaar ervaring met machine learning in productie
Ervaring met het schrijven van productieklaar code
Jouw technologiestack omvat zaken als Docker, Helm, Kubernetes, LangChain, spaCy, enz.
Ervaring met werken met LLM's (GPT, BERT, enz.)
Gevorderd niveau in Python
Je wilt grote taalmodellen testen, valideren en implementeren




Waarom Ordina Sopra steria?

Naast uitdagende werkmogelijkheden, een open werkcultuur en leuke collega’s, bieden wij jou ook de vrijheid en flexibiliteit om je professionele doelen te behalen door een ruim aanbod aan trainingen aan te bieden. Daarnaast bieden wij ook de volgende andere punten:

Een vast contract
Basis salaris tussen de €6000 en €7000 o.b.v. 40 uur
Flexibele werkomgeving waar je zelfstandig tijd en plaats kunt bepalen
Mobiliteitsbudget met keuze voor een leaseauto of eigen vervoer
Flex benefit budget en collectieve regelingen
Keuze uit een MacBook Pro (inc Apple accessoires) of Windows laptop
Een betrokken community gericht op teambuilding, gaming en evenementen




Iedereen is welkom om te solliciteren. Wij geloven namelijk in de kracht van diversiteit en waarderen inclusie. De beste ideeën en slimste oplossingen ontstaan immers in diverse teams. Daarom besteden we veel aandacht aan de samenstelling van onze high-performance teams. Zodat jij je thuis voelt en het beste uit jezelf kunt halen.




Ben je klaar om je carrière een boost te geven? Solliciteer dan direct voor de functie van Senior Data Scientist bij Ordina sopra steria!

Show more

Daarom besteden we veel aandacht aan de samenstelling van onze high-performance teams. Zodat jij je thuis voelt en het beste uit jezelf kunt halen.


Ben je klaar om je carrière een boost te geven? Solliciteer dan direct voor de functie van Senior Data Scientist bij Ordina sopra steria!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Key Responsibilities:


Financial Economic Crime (FEC) and Customer Due Diligence (CDD): Work on critical topics that significantly impact Rabobank’s operations, helping to prevent financial crimes and streamline processes for non-risky customers.
Azure Infrastructure Development: Develop, manage, and maintain high-performance machine learning and AI infrastructure on Azure.
Collaboration: Work in a multidisciplinary team to develop scalable solutions and ML pipelines, collaborating closely with teams and data scientists.
System and Model Health: Ensure the health of systems and models by monitoring data quality, performance, and business impact, and devising mitigation plans.
Issue Identification: Identify underlying issues and opportunities across the ML development cycle, introducing tools for efficient development and testing.
Solution Implementation: Implement solutions in alignment with architectural guidelines, collaborating effectively with your team.
Continuous Learning: Stay up to date with the latest technologies to continuously evolve your craft.


RequirementsRequired Skills:


Education: A completed relevant HBO or WO education.
Experience: Minimum 4 years of relevant experience in Software, Data, or ML Engineering, with at least 2 years specifically in ML Engineering working with large data sets using Python and PySpark (experience with Azure Databricks is a plus).
Software Development: Strong software development skills and good practices such as Git, release management, unit tests, and testing strategies.
Cloud Environment: Experience working in a cloud environment, preferably Azure.
Collaboration: Ability to collaborate with data scientists and machine learning practitioners to provide infrastructure support for model development and deployment.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical mind, customer-oriented, driven, and a true team player eager to learn new techniques and developments.

Title: Data Scientist I (Credit Risk)
Description:
At a glance

Do you like a job with plenty of variety? Are you interested in data, programming, Risk and stakeholder management? Do you want to work in a dynamic and multidisciplinary team, and are you keen to share your knowledge? If so, take a look at the vacancy of Modelling Data Analyst (Non Retail /Credit Risk)!

We are constantly looking for ways to improve we manage our risks. Risk Models play a pivotal role in this. These models rely on accurate data supplied by our Modelling Data Teams as part of ABN AMRO’s Finance and Risk Business Grid. We are looking for experienced, fast learning Non Retail Modelling Data Analysts who like to translate credit risk data requirements to reliable modelling data sets and are eager to contribute making our data collection processes future proof.

Your job

As a member of the Non Retail Modelling Consuming Dataset team, you supply Credit Risk Modelling with the data they need to compile risk models. On one hand your duties will consist of technical aspects such as SQL and Python programming, performing Data Quality analyses and integrating datasets. On the other hand you’ll be working on documentation and using your communicative skills for stakeholder alignment. You also play an active role in the frequent team meetings where knowledge-sharing and transparency on progress is key.

Working environment

The Finance & Risk Data Domain is part of Finance & Risk Business Grids (F&RBG), and plays an active role for all the Finance and Risk departments. We employ 250+ international professionals with different backgrounds who are driven to bring risk data management to a structurally higher level. Our aim is to generate reliable risk data on time. We do this by improving the risk data itself, data systems and data processes. We work with an Agile operating model. Our Finance and Risk Data Domain consists of 5 teams where the atmosphere is dynamic, open and informal.

The Non Retail Consumer Data set team is part of the Value Delivery Consuming Dataset cluster which is primarily responsible for supplying data for developing, monitoring and calibrating risk models. You will be working in a team that largely consist of highly motivated colleagues with international backgrounds, working in an open and informal atmosphere. Given the importance the regulatory authorities ascribe to modelling and the data underpinning it, this is a challenging and impactful role.

Your profile

Your ability and willingness to work with others is crucial for your success in this role. You are naturally someone who takes initiative, structures and organizes work well and is keen to work with others to deliver tangible results. You are practical, have an analytical approach and good communication and presentation skills. You are a strong team player and you take responsibility for your work. In the dynamic environment in which you operate, you have the ability to get all stakeholders on board.

You also have the following qualifications and skills:


a Master’s degree, preferably a beta study
highly skilled in SQL and Python
familiar with Azure DevOps, Boards and GIT repos.
experience with Agile way of working
the ability to detail and challenge data requirements
experienced with Data Management and Data Governance principles
knowledge of risk management in banking or financial institutions
excellent verbal and written communications skills
good stakeholder management skills
knowledge of Risk regulations like BCBS239, Perdarr, Basel IV or IFRS
you are eligible to work in the EU



We are offering


The gross monthly salary displayed above is based on a 36-hour work week, including vacation pay and benefit budget.
The Benefit Budget is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month.
Five weeks of vacation per year. You have the option to purchase an additional four weeks per year.
Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3,000.
Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position).
An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
An excellent pension scheme.



Interested?

Does this sound like something you’d be interested in? Send us your application as soon as possible. We very much look forward meeting you.

Equal opportunities for all

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

Disclaimer external recruitment agencies

External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

Wij vragen


Samenwerkingsgerichtheid



Wij bieden


Analytische skills
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Responsibilities:


We are hiring a senior data scientist for the machine learning and advanced analytics DS team.
Apply machine learning and advanced analytic methods to solve challenging problems and deliver scalable game solutions in development, publishing, and live operations.
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes and provide end-to-end data solutions with large-scale data analysis, experimentation, machine learning/deep learning/reinforcement learning model development, validation, and serving.
Interact cross-functionally with various teams and provide actionable business insights for stakeholders.


Requirements:


Graduated with a master’s or Ph.D. program in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, machine learning, computer science, math, economics, etc.
Expertise in one or more of the following areas: machine learning & statistical learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, statistical analysis, experimentation, NLP, computer vision, recommendation system, and any other data science-related domains.
Experience utilizing analytics, inference, experimentation, or machine learning techniques in real-world applications is preferred.
Excellent knowledge of data science methods and best practices, such as data analysis and visualization, supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and time series.
Proficient in SQL and Python.
Show more

Responsibilities:

  • We are hiring a senior data scientist for the machine learning and advanced analytics DS team.
  • Apply machine learning and advanced analytic methods to solve challenging problems and deliver scalable game solutions in development, publishing, and live operations.
  • Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes and provide end-to-end data solutions with large-scale data analysis, experimentation, machine learning/deep learning/reinforcement learning model development, validation, and serving.
  • Interact cross-functionally with various teams and provide actionable business insights for stakeholders.

Requirements:

  • Graduated with a master’s or Ph.D. program in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, machine learning, computer science, math, economics, etc.
  • Expertise in one or more of the following areas: machine learning & statistical learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, statistical analysis, experimentation, NLP, computer vision, recommendation system, and any other data science-related domains.
  • Experience utilizing analytics, inference, experimentation, or machine learning techniques in real-world applications is preferred.
  • Excellent knowledge of data science methods and best practices, such as data analysis and visualization, supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and time series.
  • Proficient in SQL and Python.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Are you a dynamic leader with a strong background in AI and analytics looking to make a strategic impact?




Join a leading industrial organization as a Technical Architect responsible for AI and Analytics. You will drive innovation by investigating new opportunities in AI and analytics, advising project teams, conducting proof of concepts, and influencing stakeholders to align technical designs with strategic goals. Your expertise will guide the development of technology roadmaps, focusing on scalability and robust solutions that integrate AI to enhance data-driven decision-making processes.




Collaboration with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders, is essential. You will manage relationships with both internal departments and external IT partners, playing a crucial role in advancing our AI and analytics capabilities to optimize operations and improve experiences.




Your role will involve:




Developing and influencing the implementation of AI projects and solutions.
Ensuring the technical design of AI and analytics landscapes aligns with long-term strategic goals.
Engaging with senior business stakeholders to ensure strong alignment and project delivery.
Optimizing existing data architectures and identifying cost-saving opportunities.




What we are looking for:




Education: Master's or Ph.D. in AI, Machine Learning, Computer Science, or related field.

Experience: At least 3-5 years of experience in developing and implementing AI models and algorithms.

Skills:

Deep understanding of AI concepts (neural networks, CNN, RNN, GAN) and frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Expertise in NLP techniques and libraries (NLTK, spaCy, BERT).
Strong programming skills in Python, R, Java, Jupyter.
Functional knowledge of data and analytics solutions such as Microsoft Azure, SAP S/4HANA, Tibco Spotfire, and Microsoft Power BI.
Language: Dutch is preferred, but flexibility is available for the right candidate.




What we offer:




Salary: Maximum gross monthly salary of €7,167 for a 40-hour work week.
Contract Type: Deta-vast, with the possibility of a free takeover after 1800 hours.
Work Mode: Hybrid model, requiring some presence in the office.
Visa and Relocation: No relocation assistance, but applications are welcome from candidates already in the Netherlands on a visa.




Are you a dynamic leader with a strong background in AI and analytics looking to make a strategic impact? Apply now to be part of our transformative journey in integrating AI technologies into core business processes.

For more information and to apply, please contact Gavindegraaf@yorteam.nl.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer Intern
Description:
About Us:

SentinelOne is defining the future of cybersecurity through our XDR platform that automatically prevents, detects, and responds to threats in real-time. Singularity XDR ingests data and leverages our patented AI models to deliver autonomous protection. With SentinelOne, organizations gain full transparency into everything happening across the network at machine speed – to defeat every attack, at every stage of the threat lifecycle.

We are a values-driven team where names are known, results are rewarded, and friendships are formed. Trust, accountability, relentlessness, ingenuity, and OneSentinel define the pillars of our collaborative and unified global culture. We're looking for people that will drive team success and collaboration across SentinelOne. If you’re enthusiastic about innovative approaches to problem-solving, we would love to speak with you about joining our team!

What will you do?

S1AI is a center of excellence within Engineering that builds frontier Products that showcase what can be done with the latest technologies, delivers them to market through a Platform that can be reused by other engineering teams, and builds capacity in People across S1 to ideate and build using these technologies.

As a member of S1AI, you will take on at least one an end to end project, working with one or more of our component teams:


Platform - which develops and operates Serenity, our production AIOps environment, on which Purple and our other intelligent services are built. This team stresses system design, software engineering skill and operational maturity.
Research - responsible for the experimentation, algorithm design and evaluation methods required to turn ideas and techniques into intelligent systems.
Knowledge - which acquires and curates the knowledge and datasets required to deliver well grounded systems. This stresses database and information design, knowledge of elicitation methods and product instrumentation; and the EQ required to organize and engage SME communities.


All three teams work at a fast pace in two week sprints, and come together at a weekly meetup, to share problems and product ideas, and discuss the latest technical developments and challenges.

What skills and knowledge should you bring?


One or more independent projects that use LLMs, Foundation Models or other current machine learning technologies.
Facility with Python and the tooling associated with machine learning experimentation, system development and delivery.
Extensive coursework in Computer Science, Software Engineering and Machine Learning (or equivalent experience in another quantitative discipline) - in particular you should have a clear understanding of the boundary between CS and ML.
Must currently be enrolled in a degree-seeking program
Ideally, a strong, practical understanding of current practices and challenges in cybersecurity.


Why us?

Our global internship program trains the next-generation of cybersecurity talent across a range of specializations, from threat intelligence to information security, engineering and marketing. Interns can learn about the network security industry from leading thinkers, grow their professional networks, and be part of a career-defining experience including:


1:1 mentorship
The opportunity to expand your knowledge and work on challenging projects
Training and Development opportunities
Connections to other recent grads, and employees across the company
Leadership speaker series where you can learn about other areas of the business and ask questions to the senior leadership team and industry experts
Fun events!


SentinelOne is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

SentinelOne participates in the E-Verify Program for all U.S. based roles.

Title: Data scientist LFI
Company: RIVM National Institute for Public Health and the Environment
Description:
Functie­omschrijving

Binnen het Rijksinstituut voor Volksgezondheid en Milieu (RIVM) ontwikkelt de Landelijke Functie Opschaling Infectieziektebestrijding (LFI) zich tot een sterke crisisorganisatie. Bij de LFI werk je nauw samen met ketenpartners binnen en buiten het RIVM in een politiek-bestuurlijke context. Een uitdagende functie waarin jij jouw flexibiliteit, wendbaarheid en talent om snel tot oplossingen te komen optimaal kunt inzetten. Als toegewijde Data Scientist die data-uitdagingen met passie omarmt en het maatschappelijk belang vooropstelt, die waardevolle inzichten levert door gebruik te maken van geavanceerde analysetechnieken en machine learning-algoritmen, waarbij je doelgericht modellen ontwikkelt, kun jij het verschil maken.

Wat ga je doen

De Data Scientists maken deel uit van het LFI datalab van het RIVM. LFI Datalab focust op het verzamelen en visualiseren van kerncijfers en KPI’s over de medisch-operationele processen voor de LFI. Deze cijfers bieden handvatten voor de LFI om de operatie, voor en tijdens een landelijke pandemie, nauwgezet te kunnen volgen. Daarnaast dienen de cijfers ter verantwoording ten tijde van A-infectieziekten die vragen om een landelijke aanpak. De cijfers zijn specifiek gericht op het ondersteunen van de LFI bij de regie op de medisch-operationele processen. Daarnaast ben je in de hele RIVM-organisatie aanwezig en kom je in aanraking met verschillende disciplines, zoals o.a. LFI operationele teams, RIVM Informatievoorziening, Stakeholders van VWS, GGD’en en RIVM. Je wordt van alle kanten bevraagd en bent betrokken bij veel projecten en programma’s.

Een greep uit je taken en werkzaamheden:

je bent verantwoordelijk voor het opstellen van duidelijke projectplannen en houdt nauwlettend toezicht op de voortgang ervan.

het automatiseren van informatie en het identificeren van patronen en trends behoren tot jouw taken, waarbij je waardevolle inzichten levert voor strategische- en tactische besluitvorming;

het integreren van data, processen en technologieën binnen en buiten de organisatie om bedrijfsprocessen te verbeteren en doelen te bereiken, is een van je prioriteiten;

je neemt actief deel aan verschillende projecten en processen, gericht op het verzamelen van informatie ter ondersteuning van de taken van de LFI;

het gebruik van geavanceerde analytische technieken en programmeertalen zoals Python, R en SQL om grote datasets te manipuleren en voorspellende modellen te ontwikkelen voor data-gedreven besluitvorming, is jouw expertise. Een voorbeeld is de IPC (van Diagnostiek en Behandelen) Integrale Plannings- en Capaciteit tool dat met behulp van Big Data, AI, modelleren en optimaliseren, prognoses, complexe data, machine learning optimaal voorbereid is op verschillende scenario's.

jij bent essentieel bij het implementeren van onze datalabfunctie, waarbij je op tactisch niveau meedenkt over de visie en daarnaast procesbeschrijvingen en werkwijzen vormgeeft;

met effectief stakeholdermanagement op diverse niveaus werk je samen met de business om de juiste functionele vragen te definiëren en geschikte datasets te identificeren, terwijl je nauw samenwerkt met technische experts;

Waar staat de LFI voor?

De Landelijke Functie Opschaling Infectieziektebestrijding (LFI) is een nieuw organisatieonderdeel van het RIVM. Het is de missie van de LFI om samen met haar ketenpartners de impact van de volgende pandemie op de volksgezondheid zo klein mogelijk te houden. Bij een infectieziektecrisis die een landelijke aanpak vereist, zorgt de LFI voor snelle opschaling en centrale aansturing van de medisch-operationele processen bij de GGD’en, zoals testen en vaccineren.

Om samen met de ketenpartners goed voorbereid te zijn, voert de LFI regie op onder andere het opleiden, trainen en oefenen van medewerkers en het maken van afspraken over informatievoorziening en snelle beschikbaarheid van grote aantallen medewerkers. Door de sterke verbinding met de GGD’en en het Centrum Infectieziektebestrijding (CIb) van het RIVM, kan de LFI snel opschalen bij een infectieziektecrisis.

De implementatie van de LFI is eind 2023 gestart en is naar verwachting eind 2026 voltooid. In deze periode geeft de LFI samen met GGD’en, andere onderdelen van het RIVM en het ministerie van VWS concrete invulling aan de ontwerpen voor onder andere aansturing, opgeschaalde diagnostiek en behandelen, grootschalig klantcontact, logistiek, scenario-ontwerp, crisiscommunicatie, informatiemanagement, inkoop, facilitaire diensten en financiën.

Ga voor meer informatie naarwww.rivm.nl/lfi.

Informeren en solliciteren??

We willen graag weten wie je bent en wat je komt halen en brengen. Jouw intrinsieke motivatie is voor ons belangrijker dan een cv zonder tikfout. Vertel je ons in je brief wat je wilt leren en wat je ons kunt leren? Luuk Meulendijks, a.i. Coördinator Informatievoorziening (IV) en Datalab (06-13647745) of corporate recruiter Paulien Wilde (06-41741898 op vakantie van 15 juli tot en met 15 augustus) beantwoorden je vragen met plezier en vertellen je alles over de LFI. Bel of app je?

De einddatum van deze vacature is langer dan gemiddeld, dit heeft te maken met de vakantieperiode. De sluitingsdatum is zondag 1 september. In de eerste weken van september zullen de gesprekken plaatsvinden.

Functie-eisen

Wie ben jij

Je wordt gedreven door nieuwsgierigheid, pro activiteit en kritisch denken. Je hebt een sterk analytisch vermogen en kunt complexe informatie structureren met grote nauwkeurigheid. Als verbinder werk je graag samen met collega's en weet je hun input te integreren in je werk. Je excelleert in plannen en organiseren, waardoor je de regie hebt over de volledigheid, juistheid en tijdigheid van de data die je verwerkt. Met uitstekende beïnvloedings- en consulting-skills weet je gebruikers van informatieproducten te betrekken en hun eisen en wensen te vertalen naar bruikbare producten. Je blijft continu werken aan zelfontwikkeling en houd je wiskundige en communicatieve vaardigheden scherp. Als essentiële schakel binnen onze LFI-processen ben jij verantwoordelijk voor het leveren van betrouwbare stuur- en verantwoordingsinformatie, en draag je bij aan de ontwikkeling van nieuwe data- en informatieproducten die voldoen aan de behoeften van onze doelgroepen.

Wat heb je verder in huis


Je beschikt over hbo/wo werk- en denkniveau, bij voorkeur in een voor de functie relevante richting zoals data science.
Je hebt ervaring met een of meerdere van de volgende programmeertalen: R, SQL of Python.
Je hebt kennis van en ervaring met Agile/Scrum werken, bij voorkeur SAFe, wat jouw adaptieve mindset en vermogen om effectief te navigeren in moderne projectaanpakken weerspiegelt.
Je kunt gevoeligheden, risico's en kansen herkennen en hier effectief op inspelen.
Je hebt ervaring met het maken van stuur- en verantwoordingsrapportages in Power BI.


Arbeids­voorwaarden


Salaris­niveau


schaal 10



Maand­salaris: Min €3404 - Max €5389

HTML:
Functie­omschrijving

Binnen het Rijksinstituut voor Volksgezondheid en Milieu (RIVM) ontwikkelt de Landelijke Functie Opschaling Infectieziektebestrijding (LFI) zich tot een sterke crisisorganisatie. Bij de LFI werk je nauw samen met ketenpartners binnen en buiten het RIVM in een politiek-bestuurlijke context. Een uitdagende functie waarin jij jouw flexibiliteit, wendbaarheid en talent om snel tot oplossingen te komen optimaal kunt inzetten. Als toegewijde Data Scientist die data-uitdagingen met passie omarmt en het maatschappelijk belang vooropstelt, die waardevolle inzichten levert door gebruik te maken van geavanceerde analysetechnieken en machine learning-algoritmen, waarbij je doelgericht modellen ontwikkelt, kun jij het verschil maken.

Wat ga je doen

De Data Scientists maken deel uit van het LFI datalab van het RIVM. LFI Datalab focust op het verzamelen en visualiseren van kerncijfers en KPI’s over de medisch-operationele processen voor de LFI. Deze cijfers bieden handvatten voor de LFI om de operatie, voor en tijdens een landelijke pandemie, nauwgezet te kunnen volgen. Daarnaast dienen de cijfers ter verantwoording ten tijde van A-infectieziekten die vragen om een landelijke aanpak. De cijfers zijn specifiek gericht op het ondersteunen van de LFI bij de regie op de medisch-operationele processen. Daarnaast ben je in de hele RIVM-organisatie aanwezig en kom je in aanraking met verschillende disciplines, zoals o.a. LFI operationele teams, RIVM Informatievoorziening, Stakeholders van VWS, GGD’en en RIVM. Je wordt van alle kanten bevraagd en bent betrokken bij veel projecten en programma’s.

Een greep uit je taken en werkzaamheden:

je bent verantwoordelijk voor het opstellen van duidelijke projectplannen en houdt nauwlettend toezicht op de voortgang ervan.

Title: Data Scientist International Investments
Description:
Als Data Scientist binnen het International Investments team verbeter jij de kwaliteit van het investeringsproces. Samen met collega's beleg je namens pensioenfondsen wereldwijd in vastgoed. Jij werkt op het spannende snijvlak van vermogensbeheer en data science. Met behulp van de laatste data science technieken zorg jij ervoor dat investeringsbeslissingen sneller, efficiënter en stevig onderbouwd worden genomen. Je bouwt mee aan een gestandaardiseerd, datagedreven beleggingsproces. Ook bedenk je en werk je mee aan de ontwikkeling van nieuwe beleggingstools. Daarnaast optimaliseer en automatiseer je bestaande beleggings- en besluitvormingsprocessen en lever je gedetailleerde inzichten via dashboards en rapportages aan zowel het team als aan de investeerders.




Je komt te werken op de afdeling International Investments. Dit team bestaat uit drieëntwintig professionals verspreid over kantoren in Amsterdam, New York en Sydney. Binnen de afdeling International Investments ben je onderdeel van het Quantitative Portfolio Management (QPM) team. Binnen het team ben jij de specialist op het gebied van data analytics en Python, de programmeertaal die binnen Bouwinvest leidend is.




Meer weten over deze vacature met bijbehorende voorwaarden?

Klik dan op de solliciteer-button om de volledige vacature te zien op onze werken-bij pagina en laat daar jouw gegevens achter bij interesse!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
HTML:
Job Description

Join us in building a revolution in the world of energy consumption for every household!

With NextEnergy we are building the energy supplier of the future. With our smart app and a dynamic purchasing system, every household can save an average of 40% on their energy bill. We are looking for highly motivated and ambitious colleagues who are not afraid to get their hands dirty and who are ready to make real impact on the energy transition. Are you ready for the next challenge?

What are you going to do?

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will fulfill a challenging role within the dynamic development team in Utrecht. Your expertise is of great value in developing an advanced data and analytics platform for the Dutch energy market. You will work hands-on on expanding the data platform, with which you automatically collect, refine and analyze data to make it shine.

By combining domain knowledge, statistics and data science techniques you recognize patterns, trends and relationships in data. You implement end-to-end solutions for the (internal) customer, where you are responsible for the design and creation of, among other things, statistical and machine learning models that make a positive contribution to the energy transition. You also formulate and test hypotheses. In doing so, you never lose sight of the requirements of the stakeholders.

Your skills in the field of software and data development, together with your deep-rooted passion for data, will really come into their own in this role as Senior Data Scientist. You will work in an organization of smart, pragmatic colleagues who enjoy complex challenges. Make an impact on the future of the Dutch energy market!

In this role, you will become part of the Data & Analytics team. This team consists of Data Engineer(s) in addition to the Data Scientist.

Job requirements

Who are you?

  • You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree (preferably in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or similar);
  • You have at least 5 years of work experience as a Data Scientist;
  • You have extended experience with: data analysis, data modeling, machine learning, and data visualization;
  • Excellent understanding of Python and/or PySpark, supplemented with other relevant data science tools/techniques;
  • You have basic data engineering and core engineering skills (versioning, CI/CD, automated testing, scalability);
  • Keen on working in a start-up environment or weary of big and slow organizations;
  • Experience working in the energy sector is a big plus;
  • Affinity with or interest in trading and willing to trade themselves possibly (high level of involvement to improve overall learning curve)
  • Fluency in English and Dutch;
  • Based in the randstad area (The Netherlands).

What do we offer?

  • competitive salary between €6100 and €7800,- per month;
  • be part of a dynamic fast-growing startup;
  • develop our one-of-a-kind service in the middle of the energy transition;
  • Pension & travel reimbursement;
  • Our events team organizes the best activities and events
  • We are always looking for talented additions to our team, as we embark on a stage of growth. So even if you are not looking for an immediate change but are interested in working and being part of the Energy revolution, please apply here and let us know what kind of role you're looking for. Be sure to include a detailed resume, highlighting your skills, experience, and areas of interest, this will allow us to consider you for upcoming positions that align with your expertise.

About NextEnergy

We are revolutionizing the supplying of energy to help consumers save money on energy. With a smart app and access to cheap market prices every consumer can use energy 40% cheaper (on average). This is better for the energy infrastructure, the consumer and the climate.

Soon we’ll take the next step with smart charging, home batteries and other ways to use your energy more efficiently. For this we have already developed a state-of-the-art system in which all energy processes are handled, and we are already a fully operating energy supplier with tens of thousands of active clients.

We are only offering our services since July '22 and our customer base is growing far beyond our initial expectations. We are already outperforming traditional energy suppliers on price offering and are disrupting the entire industry in the way we offer energy to households.

Title: Data Science Associate
Description:
Who We Are

Adaptfy is a turnkey data & analytics solution for the SHV family of companies. We support the SHV Groups with advanced Data & Analytics in all areas, elevating their operations in all industries, across markets, and throughout their entire value chains.

Adaptfy is also a joint venture formed by SHV and Metyis. Metyis is an embodiment of visionary thinking in the digital world. SHV is a globally established family of companies centered around the values of integrity, trust, curiosity, passion, and inclusivity.

SHV's history is evidence of their courage to care for people, for business performance, and for generations to come. Their success is a testament to their constant re-invention through innovation.

Adaptfy plays a pivotal role in bringing the innovation and the digital vision to life for all the SHV Groups across the world. We connect the dots for SHV, shaping the data-driven future for the whole family of companies.

What We Offer


Interact with senior stakeholders on regular basis, to drive their business towards impactful change.
Become the go-to person for end-to-end data handling, management and analytics processes.
Work with Data Engineers to take data throughout its lifecycle - acquisition, exploration, data cleaning, integration, analysis, interpretation and visualization.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What you will do


Performing data analysis in the field of Marketing Analytics, CLM/CRM analytics, and/or Risk analytics
Analyses conducted in typical analytical tools ranging from SAS, SPSS, Eviews, R, Python, SQL, Teradata, Hadoop, Access, Excel, etc.
Communicating analyses via compelling presentations
Solving problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses, and develop actionable recommendations from data and analysis
Preparing and facilitating workshops
Managing stakeholders and communicating with executives
Coaching and mentoring team members.



What You’ll Bring


3-5 years of professional work experience in the analytics domain
An advanced degree in a quantitative field (e.g. mathematics, computer programming, etc.)
An ability to think analytically, decompose problem sets, develop hypotheses and recommendations from data analysis
Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, statistics, and programming. Strong working knowledge of, Python, Hadoop, SQL, and/or R.
Working knowledge of Python data tools (e.g. Jupyter, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib)
Ability to talk the language of statistics, finance, and economics a plus
Profound knowledge of the English language
Good to have experience in the Retail and/or Banking industry
